name: Watermelon Gazpacho With Calabrian-Chili Crema
description: The addition of bright and juicy watermelon makes this chilled summer soup even more refreshing. The delicate sweetness of the melon is balanced by a Calabrian chili–spiked crema, which adds richness and a touch of heat, while toasted almonds give this gazpacho its creamy texture. Use the best extra-virgin olive oil you can find to add grassy notes.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 medium red onion (4 ounces; 110g), roughly diced
1 tablespoon (12g) kosher salt, plus more to taste
1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, toss together watermelon, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, almonds, kosher salt, and pepper. Set aside to marinate for about 1 hour.

In a blender, working in batches, purée vegetables and their liquid until smooth and creamy. Transfer soup to a large bowl. Whisk in sherry vinegar and olive oil and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.

Cover soup and chill in refrigerator for 2 hours or up to 3 days. When ready to serve, adjust seasoning again with salt and pepper to taste. Combine crema and chopped Calabrian chilies in a small bowl. Ladle chilled soup into bowls and garnish with crema mixture and diced vegetables (if desired).
